channel.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
channel.description: Up-to-date information on travel in the Upper Midwest

item.title: 10 great ways to celebrate Valentine's Day
item.description: Feed romance in the forest, at an ice castle and, of course, in chocolate shops.

item.title: Swimming in Superior
item.description: If you're lucky, you can take a refreshing dip in Lake Superior — no wetsuit required.

item.title: Door County 101
item.description: Want to check out this popular peninsula? Here's everything you need to plan a visit.

item.title: Summer on stage
item.description: In vacation towns, lightweight plays offer a midsummer's-night diversion.

item.title: Swimming holes of Duluth
item.description: In this Lake Superior town, the rivers are the place to cool off.

item.title: Great fall festivals
item.description: Here are the best autumn fests in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa, northern Illinois and western Michigan.

item.title: A feast of festivals
item.description: Here's an eater's guide to small-town fests, from strawberries to sauerkraut and kolacky to sweet corn.

item.title: Afloat in Winona
item.description: Beneath the surface, a town along the Mississippi River moves fast.

item.title: A roof in the woods
item.description: In state and county parks and forests around the Upper Midwest, visitors love their camper cabins.

item.title: The people's park
item.description: For generations, Itasca has been a sacred spot to Minnesotans.

item.title: Packer country
item.description: Like Oz, Green Bay glows green and gold.

item.title: Lighthouses of Door County
item.description: On this Lake Michigan peninsula, beacons are reminders of a more rugged past.
